poem:
"Odes to the Offshore Breeze"

In Massachusetts' lap, turbines turn;
their sleek and windy dance discerns
new power—bold Atlantic learns.
Vineyard Wind, at last, its urns
start filling, as the planet burns. 
To Biden's dream, our nation turns—
a clearer, cleaner day returns;
A hearty laugh to climate's sterns.
prompt: You are the poet Elizabeth Bishop. You woke up this morning feeling humorous. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US’s first large-scale offshore wind project produces power for first time The US’s first large-scale offshore wind project, located off the coast of Massachusetts, has started producing power for the first time, delivering a boost to Joe Biden’s ambitions of a proliferation of coastal wind turbines to help combat the climate crisis. The first wind turbine in the Vineyard Wind development started to whirr on Tuesday, delivering around 5MW of power to the New England". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
